Class NetworkDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • NetworkDevice

  • public final class NetworkDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    Check if a network device (host / port) is reachable
    Author:
    Chris Anderson <cnanderson@lbl.gov>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NetworkDevice(java.lang.String host)
      Creates a NetworkDevice with specified host, default port (80), and default timeout (1000 ms)
      NetworkDevice(java.lang.String host, int port)
      Creates a NetworkDevice with specified host and port, and default timeout (1000 ms)
      NetworkDevice(java.lang.String host, int port, int timeout)
      Creates a NetworkDevice with specified host, port, and timeout.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getHost()
      Returns the host of the NetworkDevice
      int getPort()
      Returns the port of the NetworkDevice
      int getTimeout()
      Returns the timeout (ms) of the NetworkDevice
      boolean isReachable()
      Returns a boolean if the device is reachable within the timeout.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetworkDevice

        public NetworkDevice(java.lang.String host)
        Creates a NetworkDevice with specified host, default port (80), and default timeout (1000 ms)
        Parameters:
        host - a host name or IP address, e.g. "192.168.10.10"

      • NetworkDevice

        public NetworkDevice(java.lang.String host,
             int port)
        Creates a NetworkDevice with specified host and port, and default timeout (1000 ms)
        Parameters:
        host - a host name or IP address, e.g. "192.168.10.10"
        port - a port, e.g., 80

      • NetworkDevice

        public NetworkDevice(java.lang.String host,
             int port,
             int timeout)
        Creates a NetworkDevice with specified host, port, and timeout.
        Parameters:
        host - host name or IP address, e.g. "192.168.10.10"
        port - port, e.g., 80
        timeout - timeout in ms

    • Method Detail

      • isReachable

        public boolean isReachable()
                    throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Returns a boolean if the device is reachable within the timeout. Implementation creates a java.net.Socket and tries to connect it to a java.net.InetSocketAddress
        Returns:
        Boolean
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • getHost

        public java.lang.String getHost()
        Returns the host of the NetworkDevice
        Returns:
        host

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port of the NetworkDevice
        Returns:
        port

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Returns the timeout (ms) of the NetworkDevice
        Returns:
        timeout (ms)
